intro: Eurycaulis bicallosus, commonly known as the two-spined eurycaulis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive two-spined leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
